quoteFirst: MR. GEORGE BOOTH. [_taken aback and fumbling for his watch._] I think so . . I make it
quoteLast: . [_he seizes the occasion._] Trenchard, as a very old and dear friend of your father's, you won't mind me saying how glad I was that you were present to-day. Death closes all. Indeed . .
title:
Three Plays by Granville-Barker
The Marrying of Ann Leete; The Voysey Inheritance; Waste
author: Granville-Barker, Harley, 1877-1946
